title: Beef stroganoff
description: This Russian version of beef stroganoff is rich and flavoursome, despite being super quick to make. The tomato paste and sour cream give the stew a rich, creamy taste
author: Marsha Tsitovitch

dishes.name: beef stroganoff
steps: Combine [#1|300 g|sour cream], [#2|1 tbs|tomato paste], [#9|1 tsp|water], [#8|1 tsp|salt] and [#7|0.5 tsp|pepper]. Set aside.

Heat [#11|60 ml|oil] in a large frying pan over medium heat and cook [#4|1|cut into thin wedges|onion] for 3 minutes or until light golden. Lightly dust [#3|500 g|cut into 5 mm strips|beef] with [#10|flour], shaking off excess, then add to pan with [#12|8|thinly sliced|mushrooms] and cook, turning occasionally, for 5 minutes or until the beef is browned.

Reduce heat to low, add sour cream mixture and cook for a further 4 minutes, stirring, until or warmed through. Add a little water if necessary. Be careful not to overheat or the sour cream will curdle.
Serve on a bed of [#5|cooked and buttered|fettuccine], scattered with [#6|1 small bunch(es)|roughly chopped|parsley]
